sections.title: Overview
sections.content: DC motors drive wheels, arms, and other moving parts. Access motors through the hardwareMapâ€”an FTC SDK object that provides references to configured devices. Declare motors as member variables and initialize them in runOpMode().

sections.title: Initialization and Basic Control
sections.content: The name passed to hardwareMap.get() must match your robot configuration. Power values range from -1.0 (full reverse) to 1.0 (full forward).

sections.title: Run Modes and Encoders
sections.content: Use RUN_WITHOUT_ENCODER for basic power control. Use RUN_USING_ENCODER when you need position feedback. Use RUN_TO_POSITION for moving to a target. Reset encoders before use.

sections.title: Encoder-Based Movement
sections.content: Move a motor a set distance using encoder counts.

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content: If a motor does not move: verify the configuration name matches exactly, check wiring, and ensure power is nonzero. For encoders, confirm the motor supports them and reset before use.
